content: The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" addresses eligibility for acquiring lands, easements, and rights-of-ways for construction of treatment works. It also includes provisions for rural nonprofit water associations to receive assistance for providing wastewater treatment and water supply services to communities. Additionally, the Act outlines capitalization grant agreements. The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" includes provisions for capitalization grant agreements, encouraging the use of innovative technologies in treatment works construction. The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" includes amendments to the loan program under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act, allowing loans to rural and disadvantaged communities at below-market interest rates for up to 40 years or the project's useful life. The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" allows loans from the water pollution control revolving fund to rural and disadvantaged communities at below-market interest rates. Grants are also provided to cover planning and predevelopment costs for treatment works in these communities. The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" allows loans from the water pollution control revolving fund to rural and disadvantaged communities at below-market interest rates. Grants are provided for planning and predevelopment costs, with restrictions on grant amounts per project. Definitions for rural and disadvantaged communities and negative-interest loans are also included in the Act. The "Rural Community Wastewater Treatment Affordability Act of 1994" allows states to provide zero-interest loans to rural and disadvantaged communities from their water pollution control revolving fund. The state can forgive up to 2 percent of the loan principal per year, not exceeding a total forgiveness of 20 percent over the loan term. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS amended to limit costs to 4 percent of total funds deposited into the fund. SEC. 6. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE introduces a grant program under Title VI of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. The Administrator may provide grants to organizations for training and technical assistance to rural communities on treatment works. $15,000,000 per fiscal year is authorized for this program until 1998. A conforming amendment excludes this section from another act.
